root_causes: Script references B1cDKx5 (no subvariable) but expected variable is the multi subvariable B1cDKx5_99.
Validation is applied to the wrong variable name so the multi-checkbox 'other' cell will not be validated.
instructions: Change the variable referenced in the sel/list statements to the subvariable name B1cDKx5_99 (e.g. sel if miss(B1cDKx5_99) or ~any(B1cDKx5_99,99,97,98)).
Ensure validation targets the specific multi cell (B1cDKx5_99) rather than the multi-question container (B1cDKx5).

root_causes: Entry condition GreaterThan('B2b',4).size() > 0 is not implemented: the script runs validation for all respondents instead of only those meeting the B2b>4 condition.
instructions: Apply the question's entry condition when selecting cases. For example wrap the existing selection with the condition on B2b: sel if (B2b > 4) and ( miss(B2ba) or ~any(B2ba,1,2,3,4,5,6,97,98,99) ).

If B2b is multi-coded (needs 'any greater than 4'), implement the equivalent multi-check (e.g. check each B2b subvariable or use the same helper that produced the entry condition) so only respondents meeting GreaterThan('B2b',4) are validated.

root_causes: The script checks numeric range and special codes per cell but does not execute the question's declared ValidationCode (CheckDK3D('B2cx1','B2cDKx1'); and conditional validateB1c("S7_1","B2cx1")).
Missing execution of the DK/sum validation steps means some expected logical checks (DK cross-check and validateB1c) are not performed.
instructions: Retain the per-cell numeric-range and special-code checks (these are correct) but also invoke the question's ValidationCode before or in addition to the sel-list check.

Add calls to run CheckDK3D('B2cx1','B2cDKx1'); and then, if no question errors and f('B2cDKx1').size() == 0, call validateB1c("S7_1","B2cx1"); so the DK and aggregate validations are enforced as specified in the question attributes.

Ensure results of those validation functions are used to flag respondents (include them in the sel condition or run them prior to the sel and flag their outcomes) so respondents failing those checks are listed.
